intro: Phlegmariurus dentatus, commonly known as the toothed liverwort, is a species of moss-like plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a non-vascular plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest floors or on rocky surfaces. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its lobed, leaf-like structures and a central stalk that bears spore-producing structures called sporophytes. Its leaves are often serrated or toothed, giving it its common name. Phlegmariurus dentatus plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its ecosystem.
